Change has been successfully merged

As this is a fix, can you please add a `Fixes:` tag and an entry in `CHANGELOG.md`?

You can find more information on the `Fixes:` tag at the bottom of this section in the kernel docs:

https://docs.kernel.org/process/submitting-patches.html#describe-your-changes
Acknowledged
Hi Gilbert, thanks for the fix. I have a few requests inline that need to be addressed before we merge it.
Acknowledged

It is for avoiding assert() by pldm_msgbuf_extract_p(). The assert() causes valgrind test FAIL. 

```
[66/66] Linking target tests/dsp_platform
ninja: Entering directory `/data/github/libpldm/tmp.QVOQjlcc4E'
ninja: no work to do.
 1/22 dsp/bios_table_iter                            OK               0.55s
 2/22 utils                                          OK               0.91s
 3/22 instance-id                                    OK               0.97s

 9/22 msgbuf                                         OK               1.13s
10/22 dsp/firmware_update                            OK               1.32s
11/22 dsp/pdr                                        OK               1.34s
12/22 transport/transport                            OK               1.02s
13/22 dsp/platform                                   FAIL             1.62s   exit status 1
>>> ASAN_OPTIONS=halt_on_error=1:abort_on_error=1:print_summary=1 MALLOC_PERTURB_=101 LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/data/github/libpldm/tmp.QVOQjlcc4E/src UBSAN_OPTIONS=halt_on_error=1:abort_on_error=1:print_summary=1:print_stacktrace=1 valgrind --error-exitcode=1 /data/github/libpldm/tmp.QVOQjlcc4E/tests/dsp_platform
```

I reverted the code back to previous commit and study how to fix the valgrind FAIL.
Can you provide the test log output so we can see the valgrind problem?
Also, which assert? Do you have a backtrace?

It is because of this assert(https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/src/msgbuf.h#L503) in pldm_msgbuf_extract_p() for extracting heartbeat_timer from buf.



You have fixed that though, by making the buffers an appropriate size.
Note that the `pldm_msgbuf_destroy(buf)` on line 2443 above is protecting this deref of `heartbeat_timer`.

Given you're adjusting this, can you please switch to using `PLDM_MSG_DEFINE_P()` instead and remove the `reinterpret_cast<>()` calls (along with the corresponding `NOLINT`)?

See the following two changes:

- [base: Add size and buffer macros for struct pldm_msg](https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/74449)
- [clang-tidy: Enable cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-reinterpret-cast](https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/74448)

Can you please do the same for the rest of your changes below also?
Acknowledged

CI is failing with:

```
libpldm 0.9.1

  Subprojects
    googletest          : YES

  User defined options
    buildtype           : release
    abi-compliance-check: disabled

Found ninja-1.12.1 at /usr/bin/ninja
Cleaning... 0 files.
[74/75] Linking target tests/oem_meta_fileio
ninja: Entering directory `/home/andrew/src/openbmc.org/openbmc/libpldm/origin/tmp.I1LVOr2of7'
ninja: no work to do.
 1/22 dsp/bios_table_iter                            OK               0.48s
 2/22 responder                                      OK               0.80s
 3/22 instance-id                                    OK               0.85s
 4/22 transport/transport                            OK               0.82s
 5/22 dsp/fru                                        OK               0.88s
 6/22 utils                                          OK               0.91s
 7/22 msgbuf                                         OK               0.95s
 8/22 dsp/base                                       OK               1.03s
 9/22 dsp/bios                                       OK               1.03s
10/22 dsp/bios_table                                 OK               1.04s
11/22 dsp/firmware_update                            OK               1.21s
12/22 dsp/pdr                                        OK               1.23s
13/22 msgbuf_generic                                 OK               0.46s
14/22 dsp/platform                                   FAIL             1.45s   exit status 1
>>> UBSAN_OPTIONS=halt_on_error=1:abort_on_error=1:print_summary=1:print_stacktrace=1 MESON_TEST_ITERATION=1 ASAN_OPTIONS=halt_on_error=1:abort_on_error=1:print_summary=1 MALLOC_PERTURB_=192 MSAN_OPTIONS=halt_on_error=1:abort_on_error=1:print_summary=1:print_stacktrace=1 LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/home/andrew/src/openbmc.org/openbmc/libpldm/origin/tmp.I1LVOr2of7/src valgrind --error-exitcode=1 /home/andrew/src/openbmc.org/openbmc/libpldm/origin/tmp.I1LVOr2of7/tests/dsp_platform
```

Where the log file contains:

```
[ RUN      ] SetEventReceiver.testBadDecodeRequest
../tests/dsp/platform.cpp:3713: Failure
Expected equality of these values:
  rc
    Which is: 3
  -75

[  FAILED  ] SetEventReceiver.testBadDecodeRequest (24 ms)
```

The problem is that the implementation of `decode_set_event_receiver_req()` sets the return type personality to PLDM completion codes, but here you're testing against a negative errno. `rc == 3` maps to `PLDM_ERROR_INVALID_LENGTH`, so this `EXPECT_EQ()` should be:

```
EXPECT_EQ(rc, PLDM_ERROR_INVALID_LENGTH);
```

Thank you for the help. It fixed and CI passed.

Can you please share how you run the local CI? I tried the local CI but there is no testlog-valgrind.txt in my local libpldm/build/meson-logs folder

Ah, I just did the usual except I made a commit that deleted this line:

https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/scripts/pre-submit#L5

That way after the run failed the logs were still accessible.
Acknowledged
I'd still like a `Fixes:` tag here 😊

Sorry for missing this.
It is added to commit message now.

No worries!

Now that it's there I poked at it a bit more, and this bug certainly has some history. I added a few more `Fixes:` tags as a result.
